To determine the nature of the low contrast region and its
position within the particles, high-angle annular dark-ﬁeld
raphy measurements were performed. Visualizations of the 3D
reconstructed volumes of NCs after diﬀerent reaction times are
. Animated versions of the tomograms are
also provided in the web-enhanced movies
tomography measurements show that, after 15 min of reaction
, a small cavity is present at the surface of some
a) and increases in size as the reaction
used to reconstruct the 3D morphologies, are displayed in
f. These measurements indicate that the brighter
regions observed in TEM images coincide with cavities at the
surface of the NCs. The cavities appear to form at the
the NCs at early reaction stages and subsequently grow inward
over time. A small portion of the NCs (indicated by red arrows
) appears to be hollow, without an obvious opening
These observations bear similarities with previous reports on
hollow nanoparticles, whose formation has been ascribed to
imbalance between outward and inward diﬀusion ﬂuxes during
the chemical conversion of a NC into a diﬀerent material
through reaction with a reactant present in solution. The
surface of the parent NC is ﬁrst converted into a shell of the
product material by reaction with a species present in solution,
after which further conversion can only take place through
solid-state diﬀusion of the reactant species through the NC.
In case the outward diﬀusion rate is faster than the inward
diﬀusion rate, there is a net ﬂow of material going out of the
vacancies gives rise to voids that eventually collect in a central
The nanoscale Kirkendall process has also
been recently proposed as an explanation for the conversion of

lower-left corner give an impression of the observed contrast in the NCs). Top-right inset in (e) depicts an electron diﬀraction pattern of the
corresponding sample. Panel (f) is the azimuthally integrated ED pattern depicted in (e). Reference bars in (f) are calculated patterns based

. The blue curve in (f) corresponds to the PED pattern of the parent Cu
nanocrystals. Dotted lines serve as guides for the eye.
